In continuation to Policy Circular no. Tech./133/2013 dated 08.05.2013 (copy enclosed) issued on the  captioned subject; it is reiterated that as soon as the decision of DRB or the Arbitral Tribunal or the Courts is received, the same should be placed before the concerned Member, The concerned Member will immediately form a Committee of 3 GMs who would process the matter and place their recommendations before the concerned Member. After examining the matter, the decision can be taken by the concerned Member Or Executive Committee as the case may be The concerned Member has also been made responsible to ensure that sufficient time is available for EC to take a decision on merit i.e; at least 30 days in cases where Arbitral Award is to be challenged before Single Judge of High Court and 15 days in case where further appeal is to be filed before Division Bench challenging the order of Single Judge. 2_ Recently it was observed in one of the Arbitration cases that the petition filed by NHAI before Single Judge of Delhi High Court challenging the Arbitral Award was dismissed by the Court and action on the decision of Single Judge was neither taken by the concerned PIU nor by the technical division at HQ for almost a period of 11 months The matter came to light when the directions of High Court were issued to NHAI for depositing of decretal amount on Execution Petition filed by the Contractor: 3_ The systematic   failurelnegligence as mentioned  above, has been viewed seriously by the Competent Authority and it is reiterated that the instructions issued vide said Policy Circular dated 08.05.2013 shall be adhered to meticulously and the technical divisions at HQ shall also continuously track the status of proceedings at different fora to ensure timely implementation of the directionsldecisions. Any lapse will attract strict action: 4 This issues with the approval of Chairman: P7 257 (V.KSharma) Chief General Manager (Coord: LA) To_ AlLoliicers and_employees of_HQ/ROs[PIUs[CMUs[Site Oltices NHAL
